protocol_name: Paraffin Embedding of Drosophila Pupal Tissues
protocol_name_html: Paraffin Embedding of Drosophila Pupal Tissues
description:
Drosophila Tissue Processing for Paraffin Embedding
modified by the Baehrecke Lab from published protocols by Ristifo and White, 1991 (Pubmed ID 1936557) and Muro et al., 2006 (Pubmed ID 16887831)
before_start: Collect white pre-pupae, raised at 25 degrees Celsius, every forty minutes until desired number is obtained. Age for 24 hrs at 25 degrees Celsius and then begin fixation based on the time collected for each individual.

components.data:
Puncture posterior end of staged pupa with dissecting scissors, fine forcepts, or .22 gauge needle.

Place into Eppendorf tube with 500 ul of FAAG and store overnight at 4 degrees Celsius
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Puncture posterior end of staged pupa with dissecting scissors, fine forcepts, or .22 gauge needle.

Place into Eppendorf tube with 500 ul of FAAG and store overnight at 4 degrees Celsius

(store at 4 degrees Celsius)
80% Ethanol
4% Formaldehyde
5% Acetic Acid
1% Glutaraldehyde

Measured Instructions
Total volume 250 ml FAAG:
200 ml 100% Ethanol
27.5 ml 37% Formaldehyde
12.5 ml Glacial Acetic Acid
10 ml 25% Glutaraldehyde (EM Grade)

components.data:
Remove FAAG in the hood and dispose in "Aldehyde Waste" container.

Dehydrate through ethanol series and clear in Xylenes. Rotate in nutator at RT.

Solution 1: 80% Ethanol 500 ul
components.name: Description

components.data:
Replace 100% Ethanol with 500ul Xylenes for thirty minutes.

Dispose of Xylenes in "Aldehyde Waste" container

components.data:
Paraffin Infiltration
Transfer pupae to scintillation vial with 2 ml of Xylenes using designated paintbrush.

Mark the level of Xylenes on tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Paraffin Infiltration
Transfer pupae to scintillation vial with 2 ml of Xylenes using designated paintbrush.

Mark the level of Xylenes on tube.

components.data:
Add ~20 paraffin chips (paraplast xtra) and melt in 42 degree Celsius incubator. (Volume should double) 
Leave overnight.

In 500 ml beaker, add melted paraffin and incubate at 56 degrees celsius for use tomorrow.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add ~20 paraffin chips (paraplast xtra) and melt in 42 degree Celsius incubator. (Volume should double) 
Leave overnight.

In 500 ml beaker, add melted paraffin and incubate at 56 degrees celsius for use tomorrow.

components.data:
Remove Xylenes/Wax and place onto wax waste tray. 
Add a small amount of melted paraffin at 56 degrees Celsius to dilute residual Xylene, remove and place onto wax waste tray.

Add melted 56 degree Celsius paraffin incubate for 1-2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove Xylenes/Wax and place onto wax waste tray. 
Add a small amount of melted paraffin at 56 degrees Celsius to dilute residual Xylene, remove and place onto wax waste tray.

Add melted 56 degree Celsius paraffin incubate for 1-2 hours.

components.data: Remove paraffin and replace with fresh melted 56 degree Celsius paraffin incubate for 1-2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove paraffin and replace with fresh melted 56 degree Celsius paraffin incubate for 1-2 hours.

components.data:
Remove paraffin and replace with fresh melted 56 degree Celsius paraffin and fill to the top of the glass vial.
Incubate overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Remove paraffin and replace with fresh melted 56 degree Celsius paraffin and fill to the top of the glass vial.
Incubate overnight.

components.data:
Make mold by taping the ends and sides of cut index cards and tape ends to prevent leaks. 
Pre-heat hot block to 56 degrees Celsius and cover completely with tin foil.
When hot block reaches temp, swirl pupae in the vial and quickly pour wax and pupae into mold on top of hot block. orient the samples quickly before the wax hardens. Fill the remainder of the boat with melted paraffin.
Let sit for 15 minutes to begin to solidify.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Make mold by taping the ends and sides of cut index cards and tape ends to prevent leaks. 
Pre-heat hot block to 56 degrees Celsius and cover completely with tin foil.
When hot block reaches temp, swirl pupae in the vial and quickly pour wax and pupae into mold on top of hot block. orient the samples quickly before the wax hardens. Fill the remainder of the boat with melted paraffin.
Let sit for 15 minutes to begin to solidify.

components.data: Carefully remove boat from hot block and coll overnight at room temp.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully remove boat from hot block and coll overnight at room temp.

components.data: Cut wax into individual pyramid shaped blocks for sectioning using a razor blade. Mount blocks onto chuck by melting paraffin with heated flat spatula.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cut wax into individual pyramid shaped blocks for sectioning using a razor blade. Mount blocks onto chuck by melting paraffin with heated flat spatula.

components.data: Cection blocks on microtome at 7um and float onto slides with water that are pre-warmed on slide warmer at 42 degrees Celsius. Allow the sections to expand on slide warmer for 2-5 minutes. Remove water by wicking with a kimwipe. Bake slides on 42 degree Celsius slide warmer overnight.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cection blocks on microtome at 7um and float onto slides with water that are pre-warmed on slide warmer at 42 degrees Celsius. Allow the sections to expand on slide warmer for 2-5 minutes. Remove water by wicking with a kimwipe. Bake slides on 42 degree Celsius slide warmer overnight.

components.data:
Stain Samples
Submerge slides in Weigert's Hematoxylin for 5 mins.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Stain Samples
Submerge slides in Weigert's Hematoxylin for 5 mins.

components.data: Rinse under running tap water for 5 mins.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse under running tap water for 5 mins.

components.data: Submerge in Pollak Trichrome for 7 mins.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Submerge in Pollak Trichrome for 7 mins.

Combine:
150mls Ethanol
150mls distilled water
3mls Glacial Acetic Acid

Split into 4 beakers (approx 75mls each) and add a stir bar.

Beaker 1 - Add: 0.5g Acid Fuchsin and 1.0g Ponceau 2R
Beaker 2 - Add: 0.45g Light green, SF, yellowish
Beaker 3 - Add: 0.75g Orange G and 1.5g Phosphotungstic acid
Beaker 4 - Add: 1.5g Phosphomolybdic acid

When each reagent is maximally dissolved, combine the 4 dyes and filter. Cover storage bottle in tin foil to reduce light exposure. Remake each month.

components.data: Rinse in distilled water for approx 10 seconds to remove the bulk of the stain.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Rinse in distilled water for approx 10 seconds to remove the bulk of the stain.

components.data: Submerge in Acidified distilled water for 10 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Submerge in Acidified distilled water for 10 sec.

Combine
2mls glacial acetic acid
1L distilled water

components.data: Use 78ul of Permount (for large coverslip) and apply coverslip. Let slides harden overnight.
